data.text: @DrClareFedele Strange. All these research papers state a high specificity for RATs

Update: 2x technical replicates of throat + nose swab just came up negative 🙅🏻‍♀️. Have to assume saliva tests yesterday were false +. Now I just need to reschedule my bday celebrations 🤦🏻‍♀️🥳 https://t.co/dBQYZr6y9g
@RTAndersonNJ Maybe it’s a thing with the saliva tests 🤔? Might stick to swabs from now on and sample throat and nose

@kylie_gorringe Kids really are ingenious when it comes to wagging 😂. Apparently untrue, but I had heard this too so had nothing to eat or drink before any of the tests. Unless I have really acidic saliva… but buffer should neutralise pH 🤔
@DrClareFedele We had a faint false positive on a saliva RAT a couple of weeks ago… PCR negative same day 🤷‍♂️ https://t.co/Q7ku5MGZ1i
@DrClareFedele Did you eat/drink anything before earliest positive saliva? Might affect result? see also uk students faking positivity w morning OJ to get out of school (allegedly...)
@CFlensburg Hmmm, interesting. Perhaps I’ll re-PCR in a few days. No symptoms as yet, which may be why results are sketchy 🤷🏻‍♀️
@DrClareFedele We've had a false negative from a PCR, (early on in the infection, positive a few days later), and three of the RATs look positive.
Well now I’m confused 🤔!! Anyone else had issues with RATs and false positives? https://t.co/tthWrh9dyi
@DrClareFedele Are you back at work yet? Hopefully will see you around soon
